Episodes.Title: You Set the Scene
Episodes.Plot: Former music mogul Ben Cendars returns to L.A. from a year's stint in rehab. Billionaire entrepreneur Seth Blanchard plans on bringing L.A. an NFL football team.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language and sex scenes

Episodes.Title: Always See Your Face
Episodes.Plot: Seth enlists security guard Kenny Battaglia on his quest to discover the meaning of his bizarre visions. Bo Olinville gets offered a position coaching Tyler.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language and sex scenes

Episodes.Title: The World's A Mess, It's In My Kiss
Episodes.Plot: Ben?s investigation into his daughter?s murder leads to a shocking source for black-market surveillance tapes. Inez and Jimmy pay off Jimmy?s gambling debts.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language and sex scenes

Episodes.Title: Can't Explain
Episodes.Plot: Ben and Anthony visit the athletic club where Cassie was murdered, but are dissuaded from investigating further. Eddie ridicules advice Bo gives Tyler, which prompts Bo to prove his macho prowess.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, offensive language and sex scenes

Episodes.Title: You, I'll Be Following
Episodes.Plot: Seth moves into an eco-friendly loft where he announces a dramatic venture for the future betterment of Los Angeles. Kenny strikes up a friendship with Tess, who runs a homeless center.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Sex scenes, violence, drug use and offensive language

Episodes.Title: No Matter What You Do
Episodes.Plot: Ben visits his ex-wife (Peggy Lipton) and her husband (Keith Carradine) and stumbles into a crisis of desperation. Inez is romanced by a new man, while Jimmy ends up in a violent conflict.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Sex scenes, violence, drug use and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Johnny Hit and Run Pauline
Episodes.Plot: Bo explodes as Wendy pushes him to admit he wants to sell the hobby shop. Inez's new man, a rich Englishman, takes her to London on a romantic interlude. Kenny takes Tess on a date.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Sex scenes, violence, drug use and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Lovers In Captivity
Episodes.Plot: Seth gets a visit from a televangelist who wants to join forces. Ben rebuilds his relationship with Suzy as he continues to look for a murderer. Wendy is jealous of Bo's relationship with Lily.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Sex scenes, violence, drug use and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Endangered Species
Episodes.Plot: Ben Cendars (Dennis Hopper) and Anthony Adams (Jocko Sims) track down coke-dealer Roxanne Thigpen (Tania Raymonde), who was close friends with Cassie, and Anthony shares his own disappointments with Ben.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, nudity, sex scenes & offensive language

Episodes.Title: Master of Puppets
Episodes.Plot: Ben and Anthony force Roxanne into withdrawal with the hope that she'll disclose more about Cassie's death. Seth mounts a town hall event to muster support for his homeless project.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Violence, nudity, sex scenes & offensive language

Episodes.Title: Calm Like a Bomb
Episodes.Plot: Seth grows more convinced that God is manifesting through him, although Kenny becomes more doubtful of the illusions. Inez meets a Hollywood director who holds out the promise of a new career.

Episodes.Title: All Alone Or ...
Episodes.Plot: Kenney and Maggie pressure Seth to agree to an operation for his brain tumor. Director Bauer Lermontov takes Inez to the Cinematheque's Moving Picture Ball to fast-track her acting career.

Episodes.Title: Los Angeles
Episodes.Plot: A group of Charles Manson fanatics reveal what happened  to Ben's daughter; Seth has a party to celebrate his homeless city project; a Hollywood director offers Inez relationship advice; honors for Wendy's work in a project may be interrupted.
